reviews.review_msg: One of the hardest classes I've taken, but also one of the easiest. Was tough to get a grasp of the philosophies, but the knowledge never left me once I felt the wheels turning. Txtbooks gave fresh perspectives. Take time to UNDERSTAND the material and you will do great. Don't take the classwork for granted. Exam easy if you know material well

On-line. Never seen/heard from Prof. Course was designed/presented on-line by Dr. Dergousoff. On-line confusing, so many different forms to manage btw slides, 4 different discussion groups, 3 different books etc. modules byzantine and bizarre small format writings. You have to pretend to write a "dialogue" etc. Total life sucking waste. No joy.
Great professor. Graded appropriately! Audio lectures helped in understanding the text. Would recommend this professor and will be taking more of her courses.

I had her for an online class, so I can't judge her personal teaching. It had audio lectures which weren't too helpful. The course topics were hard to understand and I didn't understand what they expected for the weekly discussions. The Pipeline book was interesting for the first few chapters but then I just found it repetative so I got bored of it
Very bossy. She definately likes it done her way. Marking was unpredicatable, and I crossed my fingers every time I handed in something. Very unflexible.

The lectures are so dry and hard to understand. She uses the most complicated words to explain the simplest ideas and it literally just made me even more confused. Lots of readings, but some of them I have no idea how it relates to the module. Also have no idea what to expect from the exam (that worths 40%) as there are like no sample questions.

If you're reading these reviews looking for a sign of whether or not to take SA 358, unless its absolutely mandatory, DONT take it! Readings were super heavy, assignments were graded very tough by TA (marks were inconsistent). I wish I hadn't taken this course, her prerecorded lectures were very dry, and the course material is very challenging

Took an online course with her. It wasn't organized that well and the prerecorded lectures were very dry and wordy (she talks fast btw, so good luck taking notes). Reading was heavy and didn't relate to assignments--would have done just as well if I had read nothing the whole semester. Overall an "ok" course. Mark depends on who you get for a TM.
